name: American Beech
description: American Beech trees are a hard wood tree and is used mainly in bentwood furniture as well as used as a long-burning firewood

name: Amur Corktree
description: The Amur Corktree is listed as an invasive species in both the US and Canada, while in China it is used heavily in traditional medicine

name: Baldcypress
description: Baldcypress are decidouus conifers native to the southeastern US while being able to grow in all soil types from sandy to clay but prefers mosist or wet soil

name: Goldenrain tree
description: The Goldenrain tree is native to Eastern Asia, introduced to Europe in 1747 and introduced to America in 1763. The trees are mainly grown as ornamental trees.

name: Japanese Pagoda Tree
description: The Pagoda Tree is native to Eastern Asia, mainly China, it is a popular ornamental tree in Europe, North America and South Africa for its white flowers

name: Katsura Tree
description: The Katsura Tree is on the endangered species list in China and classified as being lower risk when the Japanese populations are included. It can also emit a light caramel scent during leaf fall

name: Kentucky Coffeetree
description: The Kentucky Coffeetree is native to the Midwest and Upper South of North America. The seeds the tree produces can be roasted and used as a substitute for coffee beans, but unroasted they are toxic

name: Miyabe's Maple
description: The Miyabe Maple is a maple tree native to Japan. It is an endangered species often confined to scattered locations close to streams and rivers

name: Osage-orange
description: The Osage-orange is a small tree or large shrub. The fruits of the tree secrete a sticky white latex and are not generally eaten by humans

name: Sweetgum
description: The Sweetgum tree is natvie to warm temperate areas of Eastern North America as well as the tropical montane region of Central America
